momMetaData.momTitle: Managed Object Model for License Management Function

enum.name: LicenseMode
enum.description: Represents the possible license mode types.

enumMember.name: VIRGIN
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when the node is installed for the first time.

enumMember.name: LICENSECONTROLLED
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when a valid License Key file is installed.

enumMember.name: GRACE
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when an invalid or loss of License Key File is detected. This mode lasts 60 days. No alarm raised in the first 30 days. In this mode the application uses the last licensing information that was available.

enumMember.name: EMERGENCY
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when Emergency mode is activated. During this mode, capacity features which are intended for use during emergency situations are unlocked in order to provide as good accessibility as possible.

enumMember.name: MAINTENANCE
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when Maintenance mode is activated. During this mode, license controlled features are frozen to allow maintenance activities without affecting in service performances. An observation alarm is raised when Maintenance mode is unlocked and will be ceased in the following cases. - Maintenance mode is Locked manually - Automatically after 25 days of Unlock

enum.name: BasicAdmState
enum.description: Basic administrative states for a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

rule.exceptionText: Must be of the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] where T separates the time and the date parts and Z indicates the time zone in relation to UTC. Example 2000-08-01T17:17:34.1+01:00.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

class.name: LicenseM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for License Management function MOM. The main use cases of License Management function are : 1) Installation of LKF. 2) Viewing information of electronic keys present in the installed LKF. 3) License Management function modes administration.

action.name: emergencyUnlock
action.description:
Activates the Emergency Mode of License Management function.
The action may fail due to any one of the following reasons: -Command not executed, AP backup in progress: When backup or restore operation is going on. -Emergency State Mode already activated: When the Emergency Mode is already activated. -Emergency State Mode not allowed: When the two emergency state activation attempts are already used. -Unable to connect to server: When service encounters internal fault like inter service communication failure.

action.name: installLicenseKeyFile
action.description:
Installs the LKF taking it from folder /license_file on APG file system. After the installation the LKF is removed from APG file system.
The action may fail due to any one of the following reasons: -Command not executed, AP backup in progress: When backup or restore operation is going on. -Invalid license key file: When the specified LKF is invalid. -Invalid license key file path: When the specified path for LKF is wrong. -Missing License Key File: When the LKF file is missing on APG file system. -Physical file error: When the LKF is corrupted. -Unable to connect to server: When service encounters internal fault like inter service communication failure.

parameter.name: licensefile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the LKF. The LKF is expected to be present in the folder /license_file on APG file system.

action.name: exportLicenseKeyFile
action.description:
Exports the installed LKF to destination folder "license_file" on APG file system with filename <fingerprint>_lkf. The file is overwritten if it already exists in the destination folder and automatically deleted by the system after thirty days.
The action may fail due to any one of the following reasons: -Internal error: LKF not found: An internal error when exporting LKF. -Not allowed in Grace Mode: LKF cannot be exported in Grace Mode. -Not allowed in Virgin Mode: LKF cannot be exported in Virgin Mode. -Quota limit exceeded: Unable to export LKF in the destination folder. -Unable to connect to server: When service encounters internal fault like inter service communication failure.

attribute.name: licenseMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: emergencyActivationCount
attribute.description: Specifies the number of activations left for the emergency with the current LKF.

attribute.name: endDateforEmergencyMode
attribute.description: Specifies the end date until which the Emergency Mode is valid. If Emergency Mode is not set no value is displayed.

attribute.name: fingerprint
attribute.description:
Specifies the fingerprint of the AXE node in clear text. Fingerprint is in the format: <Node Name>-<Cluster IP Address>
"Node Name" is the value of attribute managedElementId in ManagedElement MOC.
"Cluster IP Address" is the IP address assigned to cluster of 2 AP nodes.
In case the OAM network is configured with both IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity, the IPv4 and IPv6 fingerprints are both valid but the attribute specifies only the valid IPv4 fingerprint value: <Node Name>-<Cluster IPv4 Address>

attribute.name: licenseMode
attribute.description: Specifies the current License Management function mode.

attribute.name: maintenanceMode
attribute.description: Allows to activate/deactivate the Maintenance Mode. Default state is not active.

attribute.name: endDateforMaintenanceMode
attribute.description: Specifies the end date until which the Maintenance Mode is valid. If Maintenance Mode is not set no value is displayed.

attribute.name: hashedFingerprint
attribute.description:
Specifies the fingerprint of the AXE node in encrypted format.
In case the OAM network is configured with both IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity, the IPv4 and IPv6 fingerprints are both valid but the attribute specifies only IPv4 fingerprint value in encrypted format.

class.name: ElectronicKey
class.description: Represents the set of Electronic Keys part of LKF.

attribute.name: electronicKeyId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Specifies the description of electronic Key.

attribute.name: startDate
attribute.description: Specifies the start date of the electronic key.

attribute.name: expiryDate
attribute.description: Sepcifies the end date of the electronic key. In case of no end date for an electronic key then there no value is displayed.

attribute.name: licensedCapacityValue
attribute.description: Specifies the capacity value of the electronic key. If value is 1, it means the key is a feature electronic key. If the value is more than 1, it means the key is a capacity electronic key and the value represents the capacity value.

attribute.name: daysToExpire
attribute.description: Specifies the number of remaining days to expire the electronic key. If the value is a number, it means the electronic key is going to expire in these number of days. If the value is "EXPIRED", it means the electronic key is expired. If the value is "NEVER", it means the electronic key never expires.
